perturbation.original_text:
BY DOWNLOADING OR INSTALLING THE SOFTWARE, OR USING THE EQUIPMENT THAT CONTAINS THIS SOFTWARE, YOU ARE
BINDING THE BUSINESS ENTITY THAT YOU REPRESENT ("CUSTOMER") TO THIS AGREEMENT. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO ALL OF THE
TERMS OF THIS AGREEMENT, THEN (A) DO NOT DOWNLOAD, INSTALL OR USE THE SOFTWARE, AND (B) YOU MAY RETURN THE
SOFTWARE FOR A FULL REFUND, OR, IF THE SOFTWARE IS SUPPLIED AS PART OF ANOTHER PRODUCT, YOU MAY RETURN THE
ENTIRE PRODUCT FOR A FULL REFUND. YOUR RIGHT TO RETURN AND REFUND EXPIRES 30 DAYS AFTER PURCHASE FROM CISCO OR
AN AUTHORIZED CISCO RESELLER, AND APPLIES ONLY IF CUSTOMER IS THE ORIGINAL END USER PURCHASER.
perturbation.changed_text:
BY DOWNLOADING OR INSTALLING THE SOFTWARE, OR USING THE EQUIPMENT THAT CONTAINS THIS SOFTWARE, YOU ARE
BINDING THE BUSINESS ENTITY THAT YOU REPRESENT ("CUSTOMER") TO THIS AGREEMENT. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO ALL OF THE
TERMS OF THIS AGREEMENT, THEN (A) DO NOT DOWNLOAD, INSTALL OR USE THE SOFTWARE, AND (B) YOU MAY RETURN THE
SOFTWARE FOR A FULL REFUND, OR, IF THE SOFTWARE IS SUPPLIED AS PART OF ANOTHER PRODUCT, YOU MAY RETURN THE
ENTIRE PRODUCT FOR A FULL REFUND. YOUR RIGHT TO RETURN AND REFUND EXPIRES 14 DAYS AFTER PURCHASE FROM CISCO OR
AN AUTHORIZED CISCO RESELLER, AND APPLIES ONLY IF CUSTOMER IS THE ORIGINAL END USER PURCHASER.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction by changing the refund period from 30 days to 14 days. This creates uncertainty about the actual return and refund deadline, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
Limited Warranty
Cisco warrants that commencing from the date of shipment to Customer (but in case of resale by an authorized Cisco reseller, commencing not more
than ninety (90) days after original shipment by Cisco), and continuing for a period of the longer of (a) ninety (90) days or (b) the software
warranty period (if any) set forth in the warranty card accompanying the Product (if any): (a) the media on which the Software is furnished will be
free of defects in materials and workmanship under normal use; and (b) the Software substantially conforms to its published specifications. The
date of shipment of a Product by Cisco is set forth on the packaging material in which the Product is shipped. Except for the foregoing, the
Software is provided AS IS. This limited warranty extends only to the Customer who is the original licensee. Customer's sole and exclusive remedy
and the entire liability of Cisco and its suppliers and licensors under this limited warranty will be, at Cisco's option, repair, replacement,
perturbation.changed_text:
Limited Warranty
Cisco warrants that commencing from the date of shipment to Customer (but in case of resale by an authorized Cisco reseller, commencing not more
than sixty (60) days after original shipment by Cisco), and continuing for a period of the longer of (a) thirty (30) days or (b) the software
warranty period (if any) set forth in the warranty card accompanying the Product (if any): (a) the media on which the Software is furnished will be
free of defects in materials and workmanship under normal use; and (b) the Software substantially conforms to its published specifications. The
date of shipment of a Product by Cisco is set forth on the packaging material in which the Product is shipped. Except for the foregoing, the
Software is provided AS IS. This limited warranty extends only to the Customer who is the original licensee. Customer's sole and exclusive remedy
and the entire liability of Cisco and its suppliers and licensors under this limited warranty will be, at Cisco's option, repair, replacement,
perturbation.explanation: The warranty period is now inconsistent. It states 60 days after resale shipment instead of 90, and that warranty only remains for 30 instead of 90 days. This creates confusion on the actual duration of the warranty, potentially leading to disputes about the warranty's validity period.

perturbation.original_text:
Customer Records. Customer grants to Cisco and its independent accountants the right to examine Customer's books, records and accounts
during Customer's normal business hours to verify compliance with this Agreement. In the event such audit discloses non-compliance with this
Agreement, Customer shall promptly pay to Cisco the appropriate license fees.
perturbation.changed_text:
Customer Records. Customer grants to Cisco and its independent accountants the right to examine Customer's books, records and accounts
during Customer's normal business hours with 30 days prior notice to verify compliance with this Agreement. In the event such audit discloses non-compliance with this
Agreement, Customer shall have 90 days to pay to Cisco the appropriate license fees.
perturbation.explanation: The modification introduces inconsistencies regarding audit notice period and payment deadlines. Initially, the contract lacks a notice period for audits and requires prompt payment upon discovery of non-compliance. Now, it states a 30 days notice period for audits, and grants 90 days to pay for any due, which creates conflict on the auditing process and payment deadlines.
